CatDescriptText: Mrs. Maybelle Adams, 1248 Union Street, Bridgeville, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" answer reads: "Yes, and not only in the city but throughout the county. This would greatly improve service.  For instance, I live in Bridgeville and work in Pittsburgh.  And by the time, the bus gets into the West End section, we're really cramped."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of a Maybelle Adams, wearing light colored head scarf and coat, holding cellophane bag and handbag, standing in front of light colored wall with windows with prop curtains and Christmas bulbs
